titleStmt.title: [...] Or, Prettie comparisons wittily grounded, which by scornefull maidens may best be expounded. To the tune of, Like to the damaske rose: the second straine to be sung twice over.

publicationStmt.publisher: For Fr. Coules, dwelling in the Old-Bayly.,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "Like to a dove-cote never haunted ..."
In two parts, separated for mounting; woodcuts at head of each part.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
